channel.title: ASF Jira
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HIVE-15919] Row count mismatch for count * query
item.description:
The following query is returning different output when run against hive and postgres.

Query:

SELECT COUNT
FROM
(SELECT LAG(COALESCE(t2.int_col_14, t1.int_col_80),22) OVER (ORDER BY t1.tinyint_col_52 DESC) AS int_col
FROM table_6 t1
INNER JOIN table_14 t2 ON ((t2.decimal0101_col_55) = (t1.decimal0101_col_9))) AS FOO;

From hive: 0
From postgres: 66903279

Attaching ddl files for the tables.
item.summary: Row count mismatch for count * query

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
It looks like vectorization is incorrectly adding a CastDecimalToBoolean on the decimal parameter to the vectorized InBloomFilter():

VectorInBloomFilterColDynamicValue[-1:boolean](CastDecimalToBoolean[2:Boolean]))

VectorizationContext.getImplicitCastExpression() just looks wrong - in the case of either decimal parameters or decimal return type, it is always casting the parameters to match the return type.
It looks like this was a quick fix for the mathematical functions, but this is not a correct solution in the general case.
Patch to try to restrict the automatic conversion behavior to just numeric functions.

Here are the results of testing the latest attachment:
https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12852940/HIVE-15919.1.patch

Looking at the related qfile failures:
vector_reduce_groupby_decimal.q: eliminate 2 dubious instances of CastDecimalToBoolean
vectorization_8.q: Comparison functions need to be added to list of implicit conversions
vectorization_13.q: Comparison functions need to be added to list of implicit conversions
vector_decimal_mapjoin.q: eliminate dubious instance of CastDecimalToBoolean

mmccline, what do you think of the solution? If you agree with this approach, I'll make the appropriate changes to the patch.
I see. After adding the comparisons the list ought to be complete. Ok let's proceed with this approach.

• Adding comparison functions to automatic conversion
  • fixing golden files
